text: Always including the user in the django template context
I am working on a small intranet site for a small company, where user should be able to post.

I have imagined a very simple authentication mechanism where people just enter their email address, and gets sent a unique login url, that sets a cookie that will always identify them for future requests.
In my template setup, I have base.html, and the other pages extend this.
I want to show logged in or register button in the base.html, but how can I ensure that the necessary variables are always a part of the context?
It seems that each view just sets up the context as they like, and there is no global context population.
Is there a way of doing this without including the user in each context creation?
Or will I have to make my own custom shortcuts to setup the context properly?
